creator: dgreggs@rational.com
text:
I have a customer using Tomcat Jakarta as the web server for a web application 
of our Rational RequisitePro tool.  They start the Tomcat server manually.  

Users that are on PCs with Win2000 are able to get to the web server.  Those 
users that are using OS Win98 and Win95 cannot get to the web pages.

Is there some incompatability between Win98 and Win95 and the tomcat server on 
the Web Server?

We checked the MDAC and it was at level 5 which we think is the correct level.

Your help would be appreciated.

Dave Greggs
Technical Representative at Rational

Could I get more details ?
- version of Tomcat used
- connector used

Can you connect using another HTTP client (like IE or Netscape), or does the 
problem only happen with RequisitePro on Win9x ?
creator: remm@apache.org
craig.mcclanahan@sun.com
text:
Need more information (as requested by Remy) to perform any further analysis of
this problem.  I use Win98-based browsers to access Tomcat-based servers a
*lot*, with no difficulties.

creator: matthias.becker@media4content.de
text:
Greetings!

It looks like i faced the same problem.
First I couldn't access tomcat 4 Beta 6 with IE 5 Win98/NT. Reinstalled Tomcat 
with the .exe installer and it seemed to work for 2 days. Then it stopped 
working.?(
I had a look in here and tried Netscape to access Tomcat and it worked. So i 
played a bit with IE 4/5 and here is the stupid little bonebreaker.

If you lazily type localhost:8080 in IE, it won't access Tomcat.
IE 4/5 needs http://localhost:8080 (without http:// and with a nonstandard 
portnumer IE couldn't figure out the protocol and don't guess http)

Matthias Becker
Content Media KG
